activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sydeia S Koker

records.addlTxt: Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Defendant Sydeia S Koker in court.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant indicates she is not eligible for SPD services but wants to see if she qualifies for a court appointed attorney. 
State puts offer on the record.  
BTC: Court appointed attorney is granted. Payment plan of $50 per month beginning: October 15, 2022. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sydeia S Koker in court. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defendant states that she wants to obtain counsel. 
State puts the global offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sydeia S Koker
Current: 2700 Anthony Lane, Apt 18, Racine, WI 53405 United States  (Effective: 08-15-2022)
Prior: 1040 Park Ave, Racine, WI 53403
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:57 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sydeia S Koker in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
